channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2024030918
item.description:
Report X-2024030918

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler was unloading in door 21and dropped package on the floor. DescribePack: Package handler didn't use hand to surface which caused the package to fall to the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We placed the package inside a bag and then inside hazmat material tote.

item.description:
Report X-2024030763

  • City: POMPANO BEACH

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The HazMat was discovered in the HazMat Cage already inside a red tote and HazMat bag. DescribePack: The box was open, torn, and soaked. Two metal cans had loose caps. They were also dented. DurationRel: 18 and MitigateEffect: Someone had already moved it to the HazMat Cage using a red tote and HazMat bag the morning before it was processed.

item.title: Report X-2024030791
item.description:
Report X-2024030791

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: PANAMA CITY
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler Trainer called QA over to truck where package was being loaded to, found package on its side with both closures on box being open. The container had leaked out bits of the contents. QA removed the package into a tote and swept up all spilled contents and placed it into the tote. DescribePack: Container had been cracked at the bottom, crack followed along the radius of the cylinder, for about half of the cylinder. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package handlers were cleared from area and P&D manager performed a follow up inspection to verify it was clear.

One plastic jug had a loose cap and leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: A red tote was used to move it to the HazMat Cage and a HazMat bag as well.

item.title: Report X-2024030866
item.description:
Report X-2024030866

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came from the NC belt and went to vanline 800. The package went all the way to the van when they pulled the package off and dropped it to the ground. When the PH dropped the package, the package started to leak internally. QA was then quickly alerted and removed the package from the loaders. DescribePack: One cap of the Zep pressure wash solution cracked open and spilled all over the other three bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the package immediately.

Outer packaging didn't had any hazmat markings or labels. DescribePack: Lead acid car battery leaking out of sides due to being defective. Outer packaging didn't had any hazmat markings or labels. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote

  • Description: 1. X-2024030446 SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: One jug in the box was leaking contents from a loose cap. The box and both jugs inside were also leaked on and soiled by a damaged box of paint. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote. 2. X-2024030447 SequenceEvent: The jerrican was found damaged in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The jerrican was dropped onto a bolt on the floor, puncturing the bottom and causing contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The jerrican was placed upside down, with the puncture on top, into a hazbag lined tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: Contents were leaking from under the cap of the 1-gallon jug in the box, even though the cap was on tight. The foil seal on the jug's spout, under the cap, did not stop the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report E-2024030391
item.description:
Report E-2024030391

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-11
  • City: LAKE PARK
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver 18151 was dispatched for a load going to Lake Park Mobil but was given a customer information sheet for Northlake Mobil. Driver did not catch this mistake and went to the wrong location. Once he arrived, he obtained an ATG reading that verified his load would not fit. The driver overfilled the tank and this resulted in a spill that impacted a drain. After investigating this with the APEC rep it was determined that the Reg tank was able to hold an additional 200 gallons of regular. Because the tanks are manifolded the rest of the product flowed into the premium tank. Only approximately 12 gallons of product was actually spilled. CDG managed the response and cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2024030201
item.description:
Report X-2024030201

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was damaged while being loaded on pre-load this morning into van. Pre-load employees coded the package a 36 and placed it onto a wooden pallet and transferred it to the Hazmat cage to be processed by Outbound. DescribePack: Package was dropped, causing the 5 gallon drum inside of box to break open from the bottom, resulting in a hole approximately 2 inches wide. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside of a hazmat bag next to the hazmat cage to avoid any further leaking.

item.title: Report X-2024030007

Report X-2024030007

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Homeland Security shipment/Plastic Pelican case locked. Xray showed weapon and undeclared ammunition inside. Held on site for FAA inspection. Subsequently released to Homeland Security.

item.title: Report X-2024021930
item.description:
Report X-2024021930

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/8/2024 at approximately 1930, Dangerous Goods Addministration received a call from Employee 3646681 at the hub facility in Miami, reporting condensation developing on the outside of a package. The shipment consisted of two cans classified as "paint" (according to the marking) packaged in dry ice. During inspection, the shipment built up frost on the outer packaging. Further investigation revealed that the package polystyrene lining was damaged, resulting in the condesation buildup. Additionally, one of the cans spilled due to an apparent damaged closure. The outer package does not appear to have UN Specification marking. The shipment has been rejected and is being held, pending an FAA investigation.
